intro: Helipterum dimorpholepis, commonly known as the two-leaved helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive two-lobed shape, giving it its specific epithet "dimorpholepis." The flowers are yellow and bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
